    VISITOR INFORMATION

    Admission
    Special tickets are not required for this exhibition. Enjoy the exhibition during regular museum hours.


    Frederic Reminton. The Advance Guard or The Military Sacrifice, 1890. George F. Harding Collection
    Members
    Members receive free admission to the museum and to the exhibition. Members needing special assistance should call member services at (312) 629-6587. To become a member or renew your membership over the phone, call (312) 575-8000. Click here if you would like to purchase a membership online. In the museum, you can join at any one of the membership desks.


    Adult Group Tickets
    To make reservations for groups of 15 or more, please contact group sales by phone: (312) 443-7494; fax: (312) 443-7494; or e-mail: groupsales@artic.edu. Group reservations can be booked with or without a slide lecture.

    School Groups
    To schedule a student tour, please call (312) 443-3679. For more information, click here.

    Location
    The museum is located at 111 S. Michigan Avenue, at the intersection of Michigan Avenue and Adams Street, on the eastern edge of Chicago's famous downtown Loop. You can also see check the Web site for parking and transportation information.

    Hotel Information
    Make a weekend of your visit. See a list of hotels that offer Art Institute packages.

    Hours
    Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday: 10:30–4:30
    Tuesday: 10:30–8:00
    Saturday and Sunday: 10:00–5:00
    The museum is closed on Thanksgiving and Christmas days.
    Telephone: (312) 443-3933
